p: At any given time, 42,452 to 51,810 individuals were receiving the intervention. In scenario 1 (2-year average enrollment), scale-up of the CCP intervention reduced the number of new HIV infections over 20 years by 498, versus 33,061 new HIV infections. The number of QALYs gained was 1,055. ( Table 2) The number of HIV-related deaths over 20 years was reduced by 62, versus 9,440 deaths.
